de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.windows
Class InputWindow

java.lang.Object
  de.wwu.muggl.ui.gui.windows.InputWindow
All Implemented Interfaces:
ShellWindow
public class InputWindow
extends java.lang.Object
implements ShellWindow

Providing the small input window for the altering the values of primitive types, their wrappers and of Strings.

Version:
1.0.0, 2010-03-11
Author:
Tim Majchrzak

Parameters:

display - The current Display.
Method Detail

show

public java.lang.Object show()
Initialize and show the window, let a type be chosen and return the parameter when it is closed.

Returns:
The chosen value (probably an UndefinedValue if the editing was canceled).

show

public java.lang.Object show(java.lang.Object variable,
                             java.lang.String typeString)
Initialize and show the window, return the parameter when it is closed.

Parameters:
variable - The parameter that can be changed.
typeString - The String representation of the parameters type.
Returns:
The (probably changed) parameter.

setInformationText

public void setInformationText(java.lang.String text)
Setter for the information text. This method will have no effect once the window is opened.

Parameters:
text - The information text for the window.

changePhase

protected void changePhase(int phase)
Change to the desired phase, enabling the needed widgets.

Parameters:
phase - The phase to change to

okButtonPressed

protected void okButtonPressed()
If the first phase is active, switch to the second phase and save the type information. Otherwise check and save the entered data and exit.

cancelButtonPressed

protected void cancelButtonPressed()
Change back to the first phase if we are in the second one and we did actually start with the first one. In any other case, close the window and discard any changes.

checkAndSaveData

protected boolean checkAndSaveData()
Check if the entered data can be parsed for the parameter type. If it is possible, parse it and store it in an new object of the appropriate type.

Returns:
true, if everything was successful, false otherwise.

getShell

public org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Shell getShell()
Getter for the current Shell.

Specified by:
getShell in interface ShellWindow
Returns:
The Shell.

doExit

public boolean doExit()
Close the current window.

Specified by:
doExit in interface ShellWindow
Returns:
true, if the closing was successfull, false otherwise.
